    Predict Cumulative Incidence

    predict_survival.Rd

    Predict Cumulative Incidence

    predict_survival(object, model, predict_times, newdata)

    Arguments

    object

    The result from initiators. Either object or model must be specified.

    model

    A glm object.

    predict_times

    a vector of follow up times to predict values for.

    newdata

    data.frame to predict survival for. Extracted from model/object if not provided.

    Value

    a list with estimated cumulative incidence curves for assigned_treatment

    equal to 0 and 1.

    Examples

    # \donttest{
data("trial_example")
working_dir <- file.path(tempdir(), "trial_emu")
dir.create(working_dir)
data_path <- file.path(working_dir, "trial_example.csv")
write.csv(trial_example, file = data_path)

i <- initiators(
  data_path = data_path,
  id = "id",
  period = "period",
  eligible = "eligible",
  treatment = "treatment",
  outcome = "outcome",
  model_var = "assigned_treatment",
  outcomeCov_var = c("catvarA", "catvarB", "catvarC", "nvarA", "nvarB", "nvarC"),
  outcomeClass = c("catvarA", "catvarB", "catvarC"),
  numCores = 1,
  data_dir = working_dir,
  use_censor = 0,
  use_weight = 0
)
#> [1] "Start data manipulation"
